intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides subvar. humile, commonly known as the dwarf buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with five petal-like sepals, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows.
